properties.areaDesc: Santa Fe Metro Area; Middle Rio Grande Valley/Albuquerque Metro Area; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 11 at 2:29PM MST until February 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...COLDER TEMPERATURES AND MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHIFTING EAST
TONIGHT...

.A potent winter storm will continue to impact New Mexico through
tonight, and many central and eastern areas of the state can
expect moderate to heavy snowfall and colder temperatures. The
heaviest snowfall will shift focus over southern portions of the
area later this evening where the highest additional accumulations
can be expected. Residents and travelers through much of northern
and central New Mexico can expect significant travel impacts
through Tuesday night.

* WHAT...Moderate to locally heavy snow expected. Total snow
accumulations of 1 to 6 inches.

* WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque
Metro Area, Santa Fe Metro Area, and Glorieta Mesa Including
Glorieta Pass.

* WHEN...Through 11 PM MST tonight.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lowest snowfall amounts will be below
canyons, while higher amounts are expected around northwest
Rio Rancho, northern portions of Santa Fe, and areas just east
of Glorieta Pass.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING
